grants.title: Community Health Innovation Initiative
grants.eligibility: 501(c)(3) organizations focused on community health initiatives. Must demonstrate community partnerships and measurable health outcomes. Previous grant recipients eligible to reapply after 2-year period.

contacts.name: Sarah Martinez
contacts.notes: Attended webinar on 1/15. Very responsive to questions.

notes.body: Initial research shows strong alignment with our community health programs. Need to gather impact data from last 3 years.
notes.author: Jessica Chen

grants.title: Digital Equity Education Grant
grants.eligibility: Organizations working to bridge the digital divide through education and access programs. Focus on underserved communities required.

notes.body: Application draft is 70% complete. Need to finalize budget section and get board approval letter.
notes.author: Marcus Johnson

notes.body: Board meeting scheduled for Jan 20th to review final draft.
notes.author: Jessica Chen

grants.title: Youth Development Leadership Program
grants.eligibility: Christian organizations developing leadership skills in young adults ages 18-25. Program must include mentorship and practical leadership experience.

contacts.name: Rebecca Williams
contacts.notes: Submitted application on 1/10. Confirmation received. Decision expected by March 1st.

notes.body: Application submitted successfully! Received confirmation email with tracking number MSF-2025-0156.
notes.author: Jessica Chen

attachments.name: Letters_of_Support.pdf
attachments.note: Combined letters of support from community partners

grants.title: Environmental Justice Community Grant
grants.eligibility: Organizations addressing environmental justice issues in communities disproportionately affected by environmental hazards. Must demonstrate community leadership and partnership.

notes.body: Interesting opportunity but may not align perfectly with our current programs. Need to assess if we have capacity to develop environmental justice initiatives.
notes.author: Marcus Johnson

grants.title: Arts & Culture Community Resilience Fund
grants.eligibility: Partnerships between nonprofit arts organizations and other community development entities. Projects must demonstrate measurable community impact through creative placemaking.

contacts.name: Lisa Park
contacts.notes: Fantastic support throughout process. Grant awarded $85,000 in December 2024.

notes.body: AWARDED! $85,000 for our community mural and storytelling project. Grant period starts February 1st, 2025.
notes.author: Jessica Chen

notes.body: Need to schedule kickoff meeting with community partners for February 5th.
notes.author: Marcus Johnson

grants.title: Mental Health Support Services
grants.eligibility: Organizations providing innovative mental health support services. Priority given to programs serving underrepresented communities and addressing systemic barriers to care.

contacts.name: Dr. Amanda Chen
contacts.notes: Provided helpful feedback on declined application. Encouraged to reapply next cycle with revised approach.

notes.body: Application was declined but received detailed feedback. Main issue was lack of evidence-based program model. Recommended to partner with academic institution for next application.
notes.author: Jessica Chen

notes.body: Reached out to Dr. Smith at local university about potential partnership for future application.
notes.author: Marcus Johnson

grants.title: Technology Access for Seniors
grants.eligibility: Programs that help adults 50+ gain digital skills and access to technology. Must serve low-income populations and demonstrate sustainable impact.

notes.body: Good fit for our senior center partnership. Need to research their specific requirements for technology training programs.
notes.author: Marcus Johnson

grants.title: Sustainable Food Systems Initiative
grants.eligibility: Multi-year initiatives that transform food systems to advance racial equity and support thriving communities. Collaboration required.

notes.body: Large opportunity but outside our current expertise. Would need significant partnerships and capacity building.
notes.author: Jessica Chen

grants.title: Community Financial Literacy Program
grants.eligibility: Organizations providing financial education and coaching services to underserved communities. Must track measurable financial outcomes.

notes.body: Started application draft. Strong alignment with our financial counseling services. Need to gather outcome data from current programs.
notes.author: Marcus Johnson

attachments.name: Financial_Program_Outcomes_2024.xlsx
attachments.note: Data from current financial literacy programs

grants.title: Rural Broadband Access Initiative
grants.eligibility: Projects that expand broadband access in rural communities. Must serve areas with limited existing infrastructure and demonstrate community support.

notes.body: Potential opportunity but requires significant technical expertise we don't currently have. Would need major partnerships.
notes.author: Jessica Chen

grants.title: Homeless Services Coordination Grant
grants.eligibility: Coordinated entry systems and supportive services for individuals and families experiencing homelessness. Must be part of Continuum of Care.

notes.body: Need to coordinate with other CoC members. Deadline is far out but application process is complex.
notes.author: Marcus Johnson

grants.title: Workforce Development Training Program
grants.eligibility: Training programs for in-demand occupations serving unemployed and underemployed adults. Must partner with employers and demonstrate job placement outcomes.

contacts.name: Robert Kim
contacts.notes: Application submitted 1/5. Very competitive program. Decision expected by March 15th.

notes.body: Submitted comprehensive application for $450,000. Strong employer partnerships included. Fingers crossed!
notes.author: Jessica Chen

attachments.name: Employer_Partnership_Letters.pdf
attachments.note: Letters of commitment from employer partners
